terms.definition: An individual who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
A partnership or other unincorporated organization or association that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
Process, pleadings, or other papers served on a non-resident investment adviser, general partner, or managing agent.
A party named in the process, pleadings, or papers served.
The Secretary's certification that the Commission was served with process, pleadings, or other papers and forwarded these documents to a named party.
Any person, including a trustee, who directs or manages, or who participates in directing or managing, the affairs of any unincorporated organization or association other than a partnership.
A corporation that is incorporated in or that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
The Secretary of the Commission who forwards a copy of the process, pleadings, or papers to each named party by registered or certified mail.
The section that defines 'Principal office and place of business'.
The records maintained by the Commission, which include a copy of the process, pleadings, or papers served.
The legal authority or control of the United States over a place.
Has the same meaning as in § 275.203A-3(c) of this chapter.
The Secretary's certification that constitutes evidence of service upon a named party.
A method used by the Secretary to forward a copy of the process, pleadings, or papers to each named party.
Agents appointed to receive service of process, pleadings, or papers on behalf of a non-resident investment adviser, general partner, or managing agent.
A managing agent who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
The activities or business managed by a managing agent.
A method used by the Secretary to forward a copy of the process, pleadings, or papers to each named party.
A location not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
The paragraph describing the Secretary's responsibility to forward documents to a named party.
An investment adviser who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
The paragraph describing the procedure for serving process, pleadings, or papers on the Commission.
A duplicate of the process, pleadings, or papers served.
Process, pleadings, or other papers served on a non-resident investment adviser, general partner, or managing agent.
A general partner who resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
The last address filed with the Commission for a named party.
The entity with which process, pleadings, or papers are filed and which forwards these documents to named parties.
A person who may act as a managing agent.
An individual, corporation, partnership, or other unincorporated organization or association that resides in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
The Secretary who forwards a copy of the process, pleadings, or papers to each named party by registered or certified mail.
The location where a corporation, partnership, or other unincorporated organization or association conducts its business.
An organization or association that is not incorporated and has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
Process, pleadings, or other papers served on a non-resident investment adviser, general partner, or managing agent.
An unincorporated organization or association that has its principal office and place of business in any place not subject to the jurisdiction of the United States.
Any proceeding initiated by the filing of an application, or upon the Commission's own motion, pursuant to any section of the Act or any rule or regulation thereunder.
The Commission's own motion to initiate a proceeding.
Any application for an order of the Commission under the Act other than an application for registration as an investment adviser.
The period of time specified in the notice during which interested persons may submit facts or request a hearing.
Individuals or entities whose protection is considered in the public interest when ordering a hearing.
Any person who may submit facts or request a hearing, stating their reasons and nature of interest in the matter.
The entity that initiates proceedings, issues orders, and considers requests for hearings.
Null
A consideration for ordering a hearing if it appears necessary or appropriate.
The earliest date upon which an order disposing of the matter may be entered, as indicated in the notice.
A section of the document that refers to specific procedural details.
The subject of the proceeding or order.
The legislation under which the Commission operates and proceedings are initiated.
A publication in the Federal Register indicating the initiation of a proceeding and relevant details.
The act of starting a proceeding by filing an application or the Commission's motion.
A regulation under which proceedings may be initiated.
Information submitted by interested persons bearing upon the desirability of a hearing.
Null
The nature of an interested person's concern in the matter.
The publication where the notice of initiation of the proceeding is published.
A factor considered when deciding whether to hold a hearing.
A consideration for ordering a hearing if it appears necessary or appropriate for investors.
A submission by an interested person asking for a hearing and stating reasons.
A decision issued by the Commission disposing of the matter.
Null
The character or essence of an interested person's concern in the matter.
The end of the period of time referred to in the notice.
A proceeding ordered by the Commission if necessary or appropriate.
The justification provided by an interested person for requesting a hearing.
A person is presumed to control a partnership if the person has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the partnership.
A person is presumed to control a partnership if the person has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the partnership.

A person is presumed to control a corporation if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities, or has the power to sell or direct the sale of 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities.
A person is presumed to control a limited liability company (LLC) if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the interests of the LLC.

An investment adviser that has assets under management of less than $25 million, or such higher amount as the Commission may by rule deem appropriate, did not have total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year, and does not control, is not controlled by, and is not under common control with another investment adviser that has assets under management of $25 million or more, or any person (other than a natural person) that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.
An investment adviser is a person or firm that provides advice about securities to clients.
Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.
The last day of the most recent fiscal year is used to determine total assets.
Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.
Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.
The Investment Advisers Act of 1940 is a U.S. federal law that regulates the conduct of investment advisers.

The total assets as shown on the balance sheet of the investment adviser or other person described, or the balance sheet of the investment adviser or such other person with its subsidiaries consolidated, whichever is larger.
Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.
A person is presumed to control a corporation if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities.
Assets under management are defined under Section 203A(a)(3) of the Act and reported on its annual updating amendment to Form ADV.
A person is presumed to control a corporation if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the corporation's voting securities.
A person is presumed to control a trust if the person is a trustee or managing agent of the trust.

A person is presumed to control a limited liability company (LLC) if the person directly or indirectly has the right to vote 25 percent or more of a class of the interests of the LLC, has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital of the LLC, or is an elected manager of the LLC.
A person is presumed to control a corporation, partnership, limited liability company, or trust under certain conditions.

The total assets as shown on the balance sheet of the investment adviser or other person described, or the balance sheet of the investment adviser or such other person with its subsidiaries consolidated, whichever is larger.
A person is presumed to control a partnership or limited liability company if the person has the right to receive upon dissolution, or has contributed, 25 percent or more of the capital.

An investment adviser that has assets under management of less than $25 million, or such higher amount as the Commission may by rule deem appropriate, did not have total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year, and does not control, is not controlled by, and is not under common control with another investment adviser that has assets under management of $25 million or more, or any person (other than a natural person) that had total assets of $5 million or more on the last day of the most recent fiscal year.
Control means the power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.
A person is presumed to control a trust if the person is a trustee or managing agent of the trust.
A person is presumed to control a trust if the person is a trustee or managing agent of the trust.
The power, directly or indirectly, to direct the management or policies of a person, whether through ownership of securities, by contract, or otherwise.
